BT2025001:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 3 treating bilateral upper lobes.
Patient: [REDACTED], 44-year-old female with severe persistent asthma status post right and left lower lobe thermoplasty sessions.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with laryngeal mask airway.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscopy performed through a laryngeal mask airway. The thermoplasty catheter was advanced sequentially to the right and left upper lobe segmental and subsegmental bronchi. A total of 60 activations were delivered (approximately 30 per upper lobe) with stable airway pressures and no visible airway trauma. No diagnostic sampling was performed.
Complications: Mild post-procedure cough only; no bronchospasm or desaturation.
Disposition: Recovered in the post-anesthesia care unit and admitted overnight to the pulmonary floor for routine post-thermoplasty observation.
